newsitem.title: CANADA: Atlanta Hawks star charged with drug possession.
newsitem.headline: Atlanta Hawks star charged with drug possession.

text.p: Atlanta Hawks basketball star Mookie Blaylock was charged with possession of marijuana after a police dog detected the drug when the player went through U.S. customs at Vancouver airport, Canadian police confirmed on Thursday.
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said the National Basketball Association forward was charged with possession of about 2 ounces (56 grams) of marijuana on Feb. 1.
"He was a complete gentleman and no trouble at all," said Sgt. Bill Twidale, of the Mounties' airport drug squad.
Blaylock, who was boarding a plane for Phoenix, was allowed to leave the country but was ordered to return to Canada for a court appearance on May 14.
A spokesman for the Atlanta Hawks team declined comment on the arrest.
The Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported on Thursday that the arrest occurred a week before his probation was to expire on an earlier marijuana charge.
Blaylock was charged in 1995 with possession and drinking and driving by Cobb County police after he was stopped for speeding. He was placed on a year's probation, which expired on Feb. 8, 1997.
Cobb County officials said there probably would not be any repercussions for Blaylock because they did not find out about the Canadian arrest before the probation expired, the newspaper reported.
